result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
8:44 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gilbert A Leblanc in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing hearing.  Deft was convicted after a 4-day JT of all counts in the Information.  Court makes record with regard to charges and penalties.  Court has reviewed the contents of the file again which now includes the PSI and the victim impact statement as well as the jail conduct reports that were submitted on a CD by the State.  
8:47 am  Atty Schwantes has met with Mr. Leblanc to review these materials with the defendant.  Mr. Leblanc has a number of factual corrections to the PSI which Atty Schwantes puts on the record.  
Court has made in the Court file's copy as to the corrections cited by Atty Schwantes.  
8:57 am  Atty Donohoo is ready to proceed with sentencing and makes record with regard to victim notification and restitution request.  Attorney Donohoo is concerned that Mr. Leblanc has a copy of the PSI and wants to make sure he does not retain that copy.  
8:58 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Donohoo.  9:11 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Schwantes.  
9:42 am  Statement by Mr. Leblanc.  
9:59 am  Court takes recess to consider everything that has been presented to the Court today.  
10:22 am  Court in session.  Court proceeds with making its record and sentencing the defendant.  

SENTENCE:  
Ct 1:  4 yrs IC & 4 yrs ES = 8 years - 213 days of SENTENCE CREDIT
Ct 2:  4 yrs IC & 4 yrs ES = 8 years, consecutive to Ct. #1
Ct 3:  2 yrs IC & 2 yrs ES = 4 years, consecutive to Cts #1 & #2
Pursuant to Sec. 973.049(2), Defendant is not to have any contact with the Crowley's while in the prison system.  

CONDITIONS OF ES:  
1)  No contact with the Crowley's including Mr. Crowley's parents, his home, his business, his children or his grandchildren.  
2)  No Internet without Agent's approval. 
3)  Pay restitution in the amount of $2,579.07.  
4)  Pay court costs.  
5)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  

10:58 am  Atty Donohoo makes record with regard to confidentiality of PSI and asks that Court address Mr. Leblanc.  11:00 am  Response by Atty Schwantes
11:00 am  Court orders deft not to have contact with the Crowleys while in prison system pursuant to Sec.  973.049(2).  Court has colloquy with defendant regarding the confidentiality of the PSI and admonishes him that he may not disclose any of the information contained in the PSI to anyone else.  Court makes further record that pursuant to Sec. 972.15(4m), the defendant is to return his copy of the PSI to the Court.  
11:02 am  Atty Schwantes makes record as to why Mr. Leblanc is confused.  Mr. Leblanc knows everything in the PSI from other sources that he already has.  Court admonishes Mr. Leblanc that anything that the Crowleys stated to the Agent are "off limits" and anything that his daughter said to Agent are absolutely confidential and he may not discuss it with anyone including his daughter.  Pursuant to Sec. 973.049(3), the Court admonishes deft he may not contact the Crowley family in any way shape or form.  He may not send them any kind of communication whatsoever.  

Court gives defendant warnings regarding:  1)  Firearms restriction; 2) Voting ineligibility; 3) Possession of body armor.  11:04 am  Court in recess.

3:11 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  Defendant Gilbert A Leblanc in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is on the calendar for a final pre-trial.  This case is scheduled for a 5-day JT next week.  There are a number of PT issues to resolve.  First, there is a pending motion of the State to exclude any reference or evidence with regard to the allegation that the victim had previously assaulted defendant's daughter approximately 40 years ago.  Court makes record as to why it is denying this Motion.  The evidence does have probative value and the Court cannot find that its probative value is substantially outweighed by any kind of unfair prejudice.  Court will not permit any details of the alleged assault.  Court makes a prelim ruling with regard to hearsay objection raised by the State in its e-mail.   Court is finding that this evidence (the allegation that the victim in this case sexually assaulted the defendant's daughter approximately 40 years ago), is not heasay when its being offered for the effect on the listener.  Atty Donohoo requests one point of clarification .  Some of the evidence found in defendant's car were pictures of the victim, some of which had comments typed by the defendant.  Response by Atty Schwantes asking that it not be introduced in that they are not to get into specific sexual acts.  Court believes it is contrary to the Court's ruling.  Court next addresses Defendant's pre-trial Motions that were filed this morning via fax.  Court did receive the State's response during noon hour.  
#1 (a) - Response by Atty Donohoo; none of the matters in letters "a thru f" are other acts.  
3:50 pm  Response by Atty Schwantes with regard to #1 of his pre-trial motions.  3:59 pm  Response by Atty Donohoo.  Continued argument on paragraphs 1(a) thru (f).  
4:06 pm  Response by Attys to Court's additional questions.  Atty Schwantes is objecting to evidence as to DVD's being sent to victim or victim's place of business.  Response by Atty Donohoo.  Court makes analysis with regard to #1 of defense pre-trial motion.  Court finds that the State has not provided defense with adequate notice of these 4 statements.  Court will do a Sullivan analysis.  Court finds there is an acceptable purpose - motive; opportunity; intent; and plan; identity;  Court next addresses 2nd factor of the analysis is relevance  Court finds there is probative value.  Court believes it is relevant.  Next - Is the probative value substantially outweighed by the danger of unfair prejudice?  Court does not believe it is unfairly prejudicial.  With regard to the brick, Court finds it admissible, with regard to things left at victim's parents home - Court finds this is admissible; the dvds mailed to residence are admissible; Court nexts deals with #1(c)c - Defense motion is granted;  Response by Atty Donohoo.  #1(c)d. There is a stipulation as to number of prior convictions - there is not to be any further testimony on the convictions;  #1(d)e. Question will be relevancy as to what is contained within the statements rather than an other acts.  #1(c)f.  Court makes record - Attys have stipulated that this is a jury determination.  Court does not believe it is an other acts issue but is part of what the State has to prove.  4:32 pm  Court takes 10 minute recess.

Defendant Gilbert A Leblanc in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 3:30 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for final pre trial. Parties confirm for trial. Court addresses Attorney Schwantes as to any offers or agreements in this case. Response by Attorney Schwantes that though some potential offers were discussed, no formal offer has been offered as defendant wishes to have his jury trial and does not wish to entertain any settlement agreement. Response by Attorney Necci. Defendant responds to Court's questions.
Court addresses jury instructions that were filed by the State at time of prior trial. Discussion
3:34 p.m. - Court addresses any motions in Limine. D.A. Necci makes a statement that he believes the only issue is regarding felon possessing firearm (Count #3) and the State's belief that this would have been a felony in Wisconsin. Response by Attorney Schwantes that it is their position that defendant was not convicted of a felony in South Carolina. State submits a copy of the paperwork for South Carolina for the Court to review.
Argument by Attorney Schwantes
Argument by D.A. Necci
Response by Attorney Schwantes
3:43 p.m. - Continued discussion/argument. Parties respond to Court's questions. State continues argument and supplements argument with documentation from conviction in Canada. Response by Attorney Schwantes. Continued argument.
3:50 p.m. - Court makes a record and  finding based on Campbell that State cannot prove that charges/conduct from S.Carolina rises to felony severity in Wisconsin. Court addresses documentation from Canada, and believes that documentation reflects conduct/charges that would be a felony here in Wisconsin. Attorney Schwantes responds to Court's questions. Court supplements its record as to its ruling as it relates to Campbell.
4:06 p.m. - Court asks if parties have any other issues regarding trial. Attorney Schwantes addresses the Court as to defendant's concerns regarding the wheelchair from the jail and requests that the defendant be allowed to walk into the courtroom rather than using the wheelchair. State has no objections.
4:08 p.m. - Attorney Schwantes addresses prior Miranda good child motion filed. At this time he will not ask for this to be addressed as the State is not planning on using statements except maybe for rebuttal. 
4:09 p.m. - Parties make a record as to stipulations, and Court goes over other trial housekeeping matters.
Court in recess @ 4:16 p.m.
Minutes filed.
